Instrument.name: The Giotto Radio Science Experiment (GRE)
Instrument.description: The Radio Science Experiment on the Giotto (GRE) spacecraft had two elements: the spacecraft telecommunications system and a set of ground antennas and associated electronics, most of which were in Australia. Much of this equipment was used for routine telecommunications as well as the GRE investigation. The spacecraft radio system included two transponders that transmitted at both S-band and C-band frequencies, and received S-band frequencies. During the encounted with comet 1P/Halley, the transmitted frequency was controlled by an on-board oscillator.
